page.title: 16HETTON SILVER BAND
page.content: The band was founded by a group of local miners in{1887.}The band can have up to 32 registered players. It relies on local schools to supply the members. The{ages range }between{10}and{70 {years.}The band hall belongs to the {national coal board.}Practice sessions are held on Sunday mornings and Thursday evenings. Over the years the band has not experienced many changes but they will soon need a set of new instruments. This will cost around Â£28,000. In{1947,}they were the {British Champions.}This year the band will be playing at Hetton Carnival, Hetton park and also the miners gala. The band have also played at the {maypole dancing.}Most of this work is voluntary as they only get paid for the gala.
